fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.activation

Interface IServiceContext


  • public interface IServiceContext
    Provides access to declared dependencies, and other resources. Also provides methods to register further services.

    This is normally provided as a parameter to a public constructor of an implementation of IServiceActivator.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

      • getUserLogger

        default org.slf4j.Logger getUserLogger()
                                throws UndeclaredDependencyException
        Gets the user (application) logger.

        Plug-in bundles should generally use this logger instance.

        Returns:
        the logger instance, or null if no dependency has been declared for IConfigService.
        Throws:
        UndeclaredDependencyException - if no dependency was declared for IConfigService (either directly or implicitly).
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IConfigService.getUserLogger(), RequireService, Configuration

      • defineService

        <T> IService<T> defineService(Class<T> type)
        Defines a typed service for the specified class or interface definition. The service may correspond to an annotation-based declaration, but this is not an absolute requirement.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class' type bound.
        Parameters:
        type - the non-null class object, normally an interface type.
        Returns:
        the immutable service definition.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getDeclaredService(Class)

      • getDeclaredService

        <T> IService<T> getDeclaredService(Class<T> type)
                            throws UndeclaredDependencyException
        Gets a declared service dependency with the specified type. Services are declared using the ActivationServices.require() annotation attribute.

        This alternative to defineService(Class) simplifies access to declared services, without requiring duplication of filter specifications (where the default expectation is that the first declaration of the type is the most relevant).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        type - a service type.
        Returns:
        either the first declared service of the specified type (without a filter), or failing that, the first declared service of the specified type (with any filter). Service are evaluated in declaration order.
        Throws:
        UndeclaredDependencyException - if no corresponding service is declared.

      • getService

        default <T> T getService(Class<T> type)
        Gets the implementation of a declared service dependency. For mandatory dependencies, this will be non-null; for optional dependencies, this will depend on the current state of the OSGi service registry.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        type - a service type.
        Returns:
        the service implementation, or null. Always non-null for mandatory dependencies.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getService(IService), getRankedServices(Class), getServiceSupplier(Class)

      • getService

        <T> T getService(IService<T> filter)
        Gets the implementation of a declared service dependency. For mandatory dependencies, this will be non-null; for optional dependencies, this will depend on the current state of the OSGi service registry.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        filter - a typed service filter, with optional filtering on service registration properties (depending upon how the filter was defined).
        Returns:
        the service implementation, or null. Always non-null for mandatory dependencies.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getService(Class), defineService(Class), getDeclaredService(Class), getRankedServices(IService), getServiceSupplier(IService)

      • getServiceSupplier

        default <T> Supplier<T> getServiceSupplier(Class<T> type)
        Gets a supplier for an implementation of a declared service dependency.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        type - a service type.
        Returns:
        a supplier for the required implementation, or null if the type cannot be matched with a declared dependency.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getService(Class)

      • getServiceSupplier

        <T> Supplier<T> getServiceSupplier(IService<T> filter)
        Gets a supplier for an implementation of a declared service dependency. This variant of getService(IService) provides an optimized supplier for accessing the highest-ranked service implementation at any given instant, for a declared optional dependency. For mandatory dependencies, usage of this variant provides no advantage compared with simply retaining a reference to the implementation returned
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        filter - a typed service filter, with optional filtering on service registration properties (depending upon how the filter was defined).
        Returns:
        a supplier for the required implementation, or null if the filter cannot be matched with a declared dependency.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getService(IService)

      • getRankedServices

        default <T> List<IRankedService<T>> getRankedServices(Class<T> type)
        Gets an ordered (and immutable) snapshot of services matching the specified service filter.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        type - a service type.
        Returns:
        an ordered (and immutable) list, or null if the type cannot be matched with a declared dependency.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getRankedServices(Class), defineService(Class), getDeclaredService(Class), getService(IService), getRankedServicesSupplier(Class)

      • getRankedServices

        <T> List<IRankedService<T>> getRankedServices(IService<T> filter)
        Gets an ordered (and immutable) snapshot of services matching the specified service filter.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        filter - a typed service filter, with optional filtering on service registration properties (depending upon how the filter was defined).
        Returns:
        an ordered (and immutable) list, or null if the filter cannot be matched with a declared dependency.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getRankedServices(Class), defineService(Class), getDeclaredService(Class), getService(IService), getRankedServicesSupplier(IService)

      • getRankedServicesSupplier

        default <T> Supplier<List<IRankedService<T>>> getRankedServicesSupplier(Class<T> type)
        Gets a supplier for ordered (and immutable) snapshots of services matching the specified service filter. This variant of getRankedServices(IService) is optimized for accessing the set of ranked services matching the specified filter more than once. The returned supplier always returns an up-to-date snapshot of the set of registered services.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        type - a service type.
        Returns:
        a supplier of ordered (and immutable) lists, or null if the type cannot be matched with a declared dependency.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getRankedServicesSupplier(IService), getRankedServices(Class)

      • getRankedServicesSupplier

        <T> Supplier<List<IRankedService<T>>> getRankedServicesSupplier(IService<T> filter)
        Gets a supplier for ordered (and immutable) snapshots of services matching the specified service filter. This variant of getRankedServices(IService) is optimized for accessing the set of ranked services matching the specified filter more than once. The returned supplier always returns an up-to-date snapshot of the set of registered services.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        filter - a typed service filter, with optional filtering on service registration properties (depending upon how the filter was defined).
        Returns:
        a supplier of ordered (and immutable) lists, or null if the filter cannot be matched with a declared dependency.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getRankedServicesSupplier(Class), getRankedServices(IService)

      • createRankedServiceTracker

        <S> IRankedServiceTracker<S> createRankedServiceTracker(Class<S> type,
                                                        Filter filter,
                                                        IRankedServiceEventListener<S> listener)
        Creates a new ranked service tracker instance, using an optional service registration property filter.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the service type, normally an interface.
        Parameters:
        type - the class object for the service type.
        filter - an OSGi filter, or null.
        listener - a listener, to be notified as services are added and removed at runtime. Will also receive notifications when first opened and when closed (either on-demand or automatically).
        Returns:
        a new service tracker instance.
        Since:
        1.0

      • register

        <T> ServiceRegistration<T> register(Class<T> type,
                                    T implementation)
        Registers a declared service implementation with the OSGi service registry. The default service ranking of 0 is used.

        Services registered with this method are automatically unregistered if the service context becomes invalidated (either due to the bundle being stopped, or due to one or more mandatory dependencies being removed dynamically at runtime).

        Services can also be registered directly using the getBundleContext(); however, these will not be automatically unregistered until the bundle is stopped. Implementors should unregister such services in the IServiceActivator.close() method.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        type - the class object for the service type.
        implementation - the service implementation object, implementing the specified interface.
        Returns:
        the service registration, which can be used later to unregister the service if necessary.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not declared using the ActivationServices.provide() annotation attribute.
        IllegalStateException - if the context has become invalidated.
        Since:
        1.0

      • register

        <T> ServiceRegistration<T> register(IService<T> service,
                                    T implementation)
        Registers a declared service implementation with the OSGi service registry. The default service ranking of 0 is used.

        Services registered with this method are automatically unregistered if the service context becomes invalidated (either due to the bundle being stopped, or due to one or more mandatory dependencies being removed dynamically at runtime).

        Services can also be registered directly using the getBundleContext(); however, these will not be automatically unregistered until the bundle is stopped. Implementors should unregister such services in the IServiceActivator.close() method.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        service - the service to register, normally defined by an interface.
        implementation - the service implementation object, implementing the specified interface.
        Returns:
        the service registration, which can be used later to unregister the service if necessary.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not declared using the ActivationServices.provide() annotation attribute.
        IllegalStateException - if the context has become invalidated.
        Since:
        1.0

      • register

        <T> ServiceRegistration<T> register(Class<T> type,
                                    T implementation,
                                    int ranking)
        Registers a declared service implementation with the OSGi service registry, with a specific service ranking.

        Services registered with this method are automatically unregistered if the service context becomes invalidated (either due to the bundle being stopped, or due to one or more mandatory dependencies being removed dynamically at runtime).

        Services can also be registered directly using the getBundleContext(); however, these will not be automatically unregistered until the bundle is stopped. Implementors should unregister such services in the IServiceActivator.close() method.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        type - the class object for the service type.
        implementation - the service implementation object, implementing the specified interface.
        ranking - the OSGi service.ranking value.
        Returns:
        the service registration, which can be used later to unregister the service if necessary.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not declared using the ActivationServices.provide() annotation attribute.
        IllegalStateException - if the context has become invalidated.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        unregister(ServiceRegistration)

      • register

        <T> ServiceRegistration<T> register(Class<T> type,
                                    ServiceFactory<T> factory,
                                    int ranking)
        Registers a service factory with the OSGi service registry, with a specific service ranking.

        Factories registered with this method are automatically unregistered if the service context becomes invalidated (either due to the bundle being stopped, or due to one or more mandatory dependencies being removed dynamically at runtime).

        Factories can also be registered directly using the getBundleContext(); however, these will not be automatically unregistered until the bundle is stopped. Implementors should unregister such services in the IServiceActivator.close() method.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        type - the class object for the service type.
        factory - the service factory object, implementing the specified interface.
        ranking - the OSGi service.ranking value.
        Returns:
        the service registration, which can be used later to unregister the service if necessary.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not declared using the ActivationServices.provide() annotation attribute.
        IllegalStateException - if the context has become invalidated.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        unregister(ServiceRegistration)

      • register

        <T> ServiceRegistration<T> register(IService<T> service,
                                    T implementation,
                                    int ranking)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                    IllegalStateException
        Registers a declared service implementation with the OSGi service registry, with a specific service ranking.

        Services registered with this method are automatically unregistered if the service context becomes invalidated (either due to the bundle being stopped, or due to one or more mandatory dependencies being removed dynamically at runtime).

        Services can also be registered directly using the getBundleContext(); however, these will not be automatically unregistered until the bundle is stopped. Implementors should unregister such services in the IServiceActivator.close() method.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        service - the service to register, normally defined by an interface.
        implementation - the service implementation object, implementing the specified interface.
        ranking - the OSGi service.ranking value.
        Returns:
        the service registration, which can be used later to unregister the service if necessary.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not declared using the ActivationServices.provide() annotation attribute.
        IllegalStateException - if the context has become invalidated.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        unregister(ServiceRegistration)

      • register

        <T> ServiceRegistration<T> register(IService<T> service,
                                    ServiceFactory<T> factory,
                                    int ranking)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                    IllegalStateException
        Registers a service factory with the OSGi service registry, with a specific service ranking.

        Factories registered with this method are automatically unregistered if the service context becomes invalidated (either due to the bundle being stopped, or due to one or more mandatory dependencies being removed dynamically at runtime).

        Factories can also be registered directly using the getBundleContext(); however, these will not be automatically unregistered until the bundle is stopped. Implementors should unregister such services in the IServiceActivator.close() method.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        service - the service to register, normally defined by an interface.
        factory - the service factory object, implementing the specified interface.
        ranking - the OSGi service.ranking value.
        Returns:
        the service registration, which can be used later to unregister the service if necessary.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not declared using the ActivationServices.provide() annotation attribute.
        IllegalStateException - if the context has become invalidated.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        unregister(ServiceRegistration)

      • unregister

        <T> void unregister(ServiceRegistration<T> registration)
        Unregisters a service registration object, to remove it from the OSGi service registry. Does not throw exceptions for already-unregistered registrations, and ignores null references.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service type bound.
        Parameters:
        registration - the registration object, provided by the register method, or null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getConfigStore

        IConfigStore getConfigStore()
                     throws UndeclaredDependencyException
        Gets the default configuration store. The configuration store dependency must be declared using ActivationServices.configuration().

        This method is idempotent, returning the same instance for all invocations. Note that the autoStoreEnabled property is set to false by default.

        Returns:
        the default configuration store.
        Throws:
        UndeclaredDependencyException - if the default configuration store dependency was not declared using package annotations.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        setConfigStoreEventListener(IConfigStoreEventListener), getConfigStore(String)

      • setConfigStoreEventListener

        void setConfigStoreEventListener(IConfigStoreEventListener listener)
                          throws UndeclaredDependencyException
        Sets the event listener for external changes to the default configuration store.
        Parameters:
        listener - the non-null listener implementation.
        Throws:
        UndeclaredDependencyException - if the default configuration store dependency was not declared using package annotations.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getConfigStore()

      • getConfigStore

        IConfigStore getConfigStore(String auxiliaryId)
                     throws UndeclaredDependencyException
        Gets an auxiliary configuration store, by ID. The configuration store dependency must be declared using ActivationServices.configuration().

        This method is idempotent, returning the same instance for all invocations. Note that the autoStoreEnabled property is set to false by default.

        Parameters:
        auxiliaryId - the auxiliary configuration store identifier.
        Returns:
        the requested auxiliary configuration store.
        Throws:
        UndeclaredDependencyException - if the requested configuration store dependency was not declared using package annotations.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        setConfigStoreEventListener(String, IConfigStoreEventListener), getConfigStore()

      • setConfigStoreEventListener

        void setConfigStoreEventListener(String auxiliaryId,
                                 IConfigStoreEventListener listener)
                          throws UndeclaredDependencyException
        Sets the event listener for external changes to an auxiliary configuration store.
        Parameters:
        auxiliaryId - the auxiliary configuration store identifier.
        listener - the non-null listener implementation.
        Throws:
        UndeclaredDependencyException - if the requested configuration store dependency was not declared using package annotations.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getConfigStore(String)

      • getDictionary

        IDictionary getDictionary(String dictionaryName)
                   throws UndeclaredDependencyException
        Gets a declared dictionary instance. The declared dictionary must be embedded in the bundle using this service context; if not present, the bundle will fail to start.

        The dictionary will automatically be registered as an OSGi service, even without invoking this method.

        The dictionary's dictionary type and format type are specified using package annotations.

        Parameters:
        dictionaryName - the non-null dictionary name.
        Returns:
        the dictionary.
        Throws:
        UndeclaredDependencyException - if the requested dictionary was not declared using package annotations.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getContextAttribute

        Object getContextAttribute(String key)
        Gets a service context attribute, if defined.

        Customized (non-generated) bundle activators extending fr.reflexe.viewshell.activation.AnnotationActivator may also define default context attributes, which can be retrieved using this method unless overridden.

        Thread-safety: this method is safe for concurrent access.

        Parameters:
        key - the non-null context attribute key.
        Returns:
        the associated value, if any.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getContextAttributeAs(String, Class), putContextAttribute(String, Object), removeContextAttribute(String)

      • getContextAttributeAs

        <T> T getContextAttributeAs(String key,
                            Class<T> asType)
        Gets a service context attribute, if defined and if the value can be cast to the specified type.

        Customized (non-generated) bundle activators extending fr.reflexe.viewshell.activation.AnnotationActivator may also define default context attributes, which can be retrieved using this method unless overridden.

        Thread-safety: this method is safe for concurrent access.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the required type.
        Parameters:
        key - the non-null context attribute key.
        asType - non-null class.
        Returns:
        the associated value, if any, and if it is of the specified type.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getContextAttribute(String)

      • putContextAttribute

        void putContextAttribute(String key,
                         Object value)
        Sets a service context attribute. Any currently-set value will be replaced. Any default value (with the same key) will be overridden (hidden) until the key is removed (note that default values cannot be replaced or removed via this interface).

        Thread-safety: this method is safe for concurrent access.

        Parameters:
        key - the non-null context attribute key.
        value - the non-null value to associate with the key.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getContextAttribute(String), removeContextAttribute(String)

      • removeContextAttribute

        void removeContextAttribute(String key)
        Removes a default service context attribute. Has no effect if the key is not currently used. Has no effect on default values.

        Thread-safety: this method is safe for concurrent access.

        Parameters:
        key - the non-null context attribute key.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getContextAttribute(String), putContextAttribute(String, Object)
